gov.usgs.anss.util

Class UC

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.util.UC
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    UC, UC, UC, UC, UC, UC

    public class UC
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds constants and other (mostly) static data. It also holds one reference to a Connection object for global access. The static methods can be hidden in a subclass if some settings need to be changed. Beware: because of the way static inheritance works, you need to define the value-returning methods in the subclass, not just the constants they return. So, to change the property filename in a subclass, define getPropertyFilename, not PROPERTY_FILENAME.

      • isTestDB

        public static boolean isTestDB()
        Return true if the user of the database (as defined by User.getUser()) is one of a few test users; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether the user is a test user.

      • JDBCHost

        public static java.lang.String JDBCHost()
        Return the host name of the MySQL server. This is taken from the user's properties unless a test database is being used.
        Returns:
        The host name of the MySQL server.

      • JDBCCatalog

        public static java.lang.String JDBCCatalog()
        Return the name of the database to use (JDBC calls this a "catalog").
        Returns:
        The name of the database.

      • JDBCDatabase

        public static java.lang.String JDBCDatabase()
        Return a URL containing the location of the database to connect to. The host name and catalog are calculated using JDBCCatalog() and JDBCHost().
        Returns:
        A JDBC URL.

      • setConnection

        public static void setConnection(java.sql.Connection Cin)
        Save a Connection for later retrieval.
        Parameters:
        Cin - The Connection to save.

      • getConnection

        public static java.sql.Connection getConnection()

        Returns:
        A reference to the saved Connection object.

      • Look

        public static void Look(java.awt.Component c)
